titles.title: Accurate Crime Trends for Schools Act
ACT for Schools Act
To direct the Attorney General to conduct a study on the feasibility of expanding the National Incident-Based Reporting System to identify crime data relating to elementary and secondary schools.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H313)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary:
1/9/2007--Introduced.
Accurate Crime Trends for Schools Act or the ACT for Schools Act - Directs the Attorney General to study and report to the appropriate congressional committees on the feasibility of expanding the National Incident-Based Reporting System to include information on the occurrence of school-related crime in elementary and secondary schools. Requires the study to identify and evaluate methods for collecting and reporting such information.
